comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1.install IBM JRE 5 in Power PC based system with Linux
2.extract the "eclipse-SDK-3.2.2-linux-gtk-ppc.tar.tar"
3.Launch the eclipse by using 
./eclipse -vmargs -Djava.compiler=none or just ./eclipse


More information:
I Downloaded the Eclipse 3.2.2 for power pc from Eclipse site, the name of the tar file is 
"eclipse-SDK-3.2.2-linux-gtk-ppc.tar.tar". I extarcted this into /usr/local/ide/ 
My Linux server is a power PC based machine (not x86/Intel), and IBM JRE 1.5 & 1.4 installed in it under the following locations

JRE 1.5   ---- /opt/ibm/java2-ppc64-50/jre/bin
JRE 1.4.2 ---- /opt/IBMJava2-ppc64-142/jre/bin/

I have "/opt/ibm/java2-ppc64-50/jre/bin" in PATH also.

I am trying to connect the linux server by using the putty from the windows xp machine, and installed the XServer (Xming) in my windows xp machine which will help to see the GUI aplications of Linux Server on windows desk top.

Then I did cd /usr/local/ide/eclipse 
There I have launched the eclipse by using the following command
"./eclipse -vmargs -Djava.compiler=none"(Found this option while downloading the eclipse).

But the eclipse is not launched, it gives the error window saying that "An error has occured, see the log file under "/home/userdir/workspace/.metadata/.log".
The log file contains the following error.
I tried in many different ways by giving the options for eclipse as  "-vmargs -Djava.compiler=none" , given the JRE 1.4 as -VM arguement, increased the heap size (XMx) so on.

Looks like a problem loading the SWT library. Moving to SWT.

First a detail, the downloaded file should have been eclipse-SDK-3.2.2-linux-gtk-ppc.tar.gz not eclipse-SDK-3.2.2-linux-gtk-ppc.tar.tar.  I assume this was just a typo.

Does the following indicate any dependent libraries are missing?
%> cd /usr/local/ide/eclipse/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/87/1/.cp/
%> ldd libswt-pi-gtk-3236.so

Just wanted to point out that you are forgetting an argument in your startup. Even if you got your vm issue sorted out, Eclipse would not be able to open a workspace.

From the Eclipse 3.2.2 PPC download click through:

Eclipse fails to create a lock file with reason "No locks available."  To launch eclipse you must disable file 
locking using the osgi.locking property. For example, you could launch eclipse as follows:

"eclipse -vmargs -Dosgi.locking=none".

You're using a 64 bit VM.
Try using a 32 bit VM instead.
Please try running with the 32 bit JVM. BTW, if you are using the IBM 5 JRE, you might need to use the -Xnojit option (see Bug 116730).
